content:
I was reading Voevodsky's unfinished Notes on categorical probability.

I was wondering if the people here could guide me to other resources on categorical probability theory here (or even categorical measure theory)?
This seems interesting, though it seems to be going in a different direction. I'll give this a look! Thanks!
I'd suggest "A synthetic approach to Markov kernels" as a starting point, https://arxiv.org/abs/1908.07021

There was a conference on that subject, which was held here.

That is, categorical probability theory, and the categorical approach to Markov kernels in particular.

You can watch the talks and read what people said about them by going to this location:

  • Categorical Probability and Statistics 2020.

You'll see lots of discussions....

It may be easier to start with the list of talks here:

  • Categorical Probability and Statistics: list of talks, slides and videos.
